sidebar.serverDisconnectedMsg: The proxy server has been stopped or is restarting.

header.usageDescription: Monitor your API usage, token consumption, and request logs

home.quickStartDesc: Get up and running in 4 steps. Connect providers, route models, monitor everything.
home.step1Desc: Go to {endpoint} → Registered Keys. Generate one key per environment.
home.step2Desc: Add accounts in {providers}. Supports OAuth, API Key, and free tiers.
home.step3Desc: Set base URL to {url} in your IDE or API client.
home.step4Desc: Track tokens, cost and errors in {logs} and {analytics}.
home.noModelsAvailable: No models available for this provider.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.overviewDescription: Monitor your API usage patterns, token consumption, costs, and activity trends across all providers and models.
analytics.evalsDescription: Run evaluation suites to test and validate your LLM endpoints. Compare model quality, detect regressions, and benchmark latency.

apiManager.title: API Keys
apiManager.revokeConfirm: Are you sure you want to revoke this API key?
apiManager.noKeysDesc: Create your first API key to authenticate requests to your endpoint
apiManager.keyManagementDesc: Create and manage API keys for authenticating requests to your endpoint
apiManager.keysSecurityNote: Each key isolates usage tracking and can be revoked independently. Keys are masked after creation for security.
apiManager.name: Name
apiManager.tipAuth: Use API keys in the Authorization header as Bearer YOUR_KEY
apiManager.tipSecure: Keys are only shown once during creation — store them securely
apiManager.tipSeparate: Create separate keys for different clients or environments
apiManager.tipRestrict: Restrict keys to specific models for better security and cost control
apiManager.keyNameDesc: Choose a descriptive name to identify this key's purpose
apiManager.keyCreatedNote: Copy and store this key now — it won't be shown again.
apiManager.allowAllInfo: This key can access all available models.
apiManager.restrictInfo: This key can access {selected} of {total} models.
apiManager.searchModels: Search models by name or provider...
apiManager.keyNameTooLong: Key name must be {max} characters or less
apiManager.keyNameInvalid: Key name can only contain letters, numbers, spaces, hyphens, and underscores
apiManager.failedCreateKeyRetry: Failed to create key. Please try again.
apiManager.failedDeleteKeyRetry: Failed to delete key. Please try again.
apiManager.failedUpdatePermissionsRetry: Failed to update permissions. Please try again.
apiManager.allowAllDesc: This key can access all available models.
apiManager.restrictDesc: This key can access {selectedCount} of {totalModels} models.

cliTools.title: CLI Tools
cliTools.noActiveProvidersDesc: Please add and connect providers first to configure CLI tools.

combos.title: Combos
combos.description: Create model combos with weighted routing and fallback support
combos.priorityDesc: Sequential fallback: tries model 1 first, then 2, etc.
combos.weightedDesc: Distributes traffic by weight percentage with fallback
combos.roundRobinDesc: Circular distribution: each request goes to the next model in rotation
combos.randomDesc: Uniform random selection, then fallback to remaining models
combos.leastUsedDesc: Picks the model with fewest requests, balancing load over time
combos.costOptimizedDesc: Routes to the cheapest model first based on pricing
combos.advancedHint: Leave empty to use global defaults. These override per-provider settings.

endpoint.title: API Endpoint
endpoint.disableConfirm: Are you sure you want to disable cloud proxy?
endpoint.chatDesc: Streaming & non-streaming chat with all providers
endpoint.embeddingsDesc: Text embeddings for search & RAG pipelines
endpoint.rerankDesc: Rerank documents by relevance to a query
endpoint.cloudBenefitAccess: Access your API from anywhere in the world
endpoint.cloudBenefitShare: Share endpoint with your team easily
endpoint.cloudBenefitPorts: No need to open ports or configure firewall
endpoint.cloudSessionNote: Cloud will keep your auth session for 1 day. If not used, it will be automatically deleted.
endpoint.cloudUnstableNote: Cloud is currently unstable with Claude Code OAuth in some cases.
endpoint.disableWarning: All auth sessions will be deleted from cloud.

health.title: System Health
health.description: Real-time monitoring of your OmniRoute instance
health.noCBData: No circuit breaker data available. Make some requests first.
health.resetConfirm: Reset all circuit breakers to healthy state? This will clear all failure counts and restore all providers to operational status.

onboarding.welcomeDesc: OmniRoute is your local AI API proxy. It routes requests to multiple AI providers with load balancing, failover, and usage tracking.
onboarding.securityDesc: Set a password to protect your dashboard, or skip for now.
onboarding.providerDesc: Connect your first AI provider. You can add more later.
onboarding.testDesc: Let's verify your provider connection works.
onboarding.connectionSuccessful: Connection successful! Your provider is ready.
onboarding.noProviderFound: No provider found. You can add one from the dashboard later.
onboarding.testFailed: Test failed, but you can configure this later.
onboarding.couldNotTest: Could not test right now. You can test from the dashboard.
onboarding.doneDesc: You're all set! Your OmniRoute instance is configured and ready to proxy AI requests.
onboarding.failedSetPassword: Failed to set password. Try again.
onboarding.failedAddProvider: Failed to add provider. Try again.

providers.title: Providers
providers.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this provider?
providers.compatibleHint: Use the buttons above to add OpenAI or Anthropic compatible endpoints
providers.configureNewProvider: Configure a new AI provider to use with your applications.
providers.apiKeySecure: Your API key will be encrypted and stored securely.
providers.oauth2Desc: Connect your account using OAuth2 authentication.
providers.displayNameHint: Optional. A friendly name to identify this configuration.
providers.activeDescription: Enable this provider for use in your applications
providers.errorOccurred: An error occurred. Please try again.
providers.prefixHint: Required. Unique prefix for model names.
providers.nameHint: Required. A friendly label for this node.
providers.connectionFailed: Connection failed. Check URL and key.
providers.failedSaveConnectionRetry: Failed to save connection. Please try again.
providers.addConnectionToImport: Add a connection to enable importing.
providers.enableRateLimitProtection: Click to enable rate limit protection
providers.disableRateLimitProtection: Click to disable rate limit protection
providers.importSuccessCount: Successfully imported {count, plural, one {# model} other {# models}}!
providers.noNewModelsAddedExisting: No new models were added (all already exist).
providers.importDoneCount: ✓ Done! {count, plural, one {# model imported.} other {# models imported.}}
providers.singleConnectionPerCompatible: Only one connection is allowed per compatible node. Add another node if you need more connections.
providers.providerProxyConfigureHint: Configure proxy for all connections of this provider
providers.addFirstConnectionHint: Add your first connection to get started
providers.aliasExistsAlert: Alias "{alias}" already exists. Please use a different model or edit existing alias.
providers.openRouterAnyModelHint: OpenRouter supports any model. Add models and create aliases for quick access.
providers.customModelsHint: Add model IDs not in the default list. These will be available for routing.
providers.allSuggestedAliasesExist: All suggested aliases already exist. Please choose a different model or remove conflicting aliases.
providers.failedAddModelTryAgain: Failed to add model. Please try again.
providers.failedSaveImportedModel: Failed to save imported model to custom database
providers.failedImportModelsTryAgain: Failed to import models. Please try again.
providers.failedRemoveModelFromDatabase: Failed to remove model from database
providers.failedDeleteModelTryAgain: Failed to delete model. Please try again.
providers.compatibleModelsDescription: Add {type}-compatible models manually or import them from the /models endpoint.
providers.apiKeyValidationFailed: API key validation failed. Please check your key and try again.
providers.validationChecksAnthropicCompatible: Validation checks {provider} by verifying the API key.
providers.validationChecksOpenAiCompatible: Validation checks {provider} via /models on your base URL.
providers.leaveBlankKeepCurrentApiKey: Leave blank to keep the current API key.
providers.compatibleBaseUrlHint: Use the base URL (ending in /v1) for your {type}-compatible API.

settings.title: Settings
settings.clearDataConfirm: This will permanently delete all data. Are you sure?
settings.localMode: Local Mode — All data stored on your machine
settings.switchThemes: Switch between light and dark themes
settings.hideHealthLogsDesc: When ON, suppress [HealthCheck] messages in server console
settings.globalProxyDesc: Configure a global outbound proxy for all API calls. Individual providers, combos, and keys can override this.
settings.systemPromptDesc: Injected into all requests at proxy level
settings.systemPromptPlaceholder: Enter system prompt to inject into all requests...
settings.systemPromptHint: This prompt is prepended to the system message of every request. Use for global instructions, safety guidelines, or response formatting rules.
settings.thinkingBudgetDesc: Control AI reasoning token usage across all requests
settings.passthroughDesc: No changes — client controls thinking budget
settings.autoDesc: Strip all thinking config — let provider decide
settings.customDesc: Set a fixed token budget for all requests
settings.adaptiveDesc: Scale budget based on request complexity
settings.adaptiveHint: Adaptive mode scales from this base level based on message count, tool usage, and prompt length.
settings.requireLoginDesc: When ON, dashboard requires password. When OFF, access without login.
settings.requireAuthModelsDesc: When ON, the /v1/models endpoint returns 404 for unauthenticated requests. Prevents model discovery by unauthorized users.
settings.blockedProvidersDesc: Hide specific providers from the /v1/models response. Blocked providers will not appear in model listings.
settings.p2cDesc: Pick 2 random, use the healthier one
settings.modelAliasesDesc: Wildcard patterns to remap model names • Use * and ?
settings.clearLocalDataConfirm: Clear all local data? This will reset your preferences.
settings.ipAccessControlDesc: Block or allow specific IP addresses
settings.fallbackChainsDesc: Define provider fallback order per model
settings.noFallbackChainsDesc: Create a chain to define provider fallback order for a model.
settings.fillModelAndProviders: Please fill model name and providers
settings.defaultStrategyDesc: Applied to new combos without explicit strategy
settings.providerOverridesDesc: Override timeout and retries per provider. Provider settings override global defaults.
settings.providerProfilesDesc: Separate resilience settings for OAuth (session-based) and API Key (metered) providers. OAuth providers have stricter thresholds due to lower rate limits.
settings.rateLimitingDesc: API Key providers are automatically rate-limited with safe defaults. Limits are learned from response headers and adapt over time.
settings.noCircuitBreakers: No circuit breakers active yet. They are created automatically when requests flow through the combo pipeline.
settings.allOperational: All systems operational — no lockouts or tripped breakers
settings.allDataLocal: All data stored locally on your machine
settings.confirmDbImportDesc: This will replace all current data with the content from {file}. A backup will be created automatically before the import.
settings.backupRetentionDesc: Database snapshots are created automatically before restore and every 15 minutes when data changes. Retention: 24 hourly + 30 daily backups with smart rotation.
settings.noBackupsYet: No backups available yet. Backups will be created automatically when data changes.
settings.invalidFileType: Invalid file type. Only .sqlite files are accepted.
settings.modelPricingDesc: Configure cost rates per model • All rates in $/1M tokens
settings.resetPricingConfirm: Reset all pricing for {provider} to defaults?
settings.pricingDescInput: Input: tokens sent to the model
settings.pricingDescCached: Cached: reused input (~50% of input rate)
settings.pricingDescReasoning: Reasoning: thinking tokens (falls back to Output)
settings.pricingDescCacheWrite: Cache Write: creating cache entries (falls back to Input)
settings.pricingDescFormula: Cost = (input × input_rate) + (output × output_rate) + (cached × cached_rate) per million tokens.
settings.costCalculationDesc: Costs are calculated based on token usage and pricing rates configured for each model.
settings.pricingFormatDesc: All rates are in $/1M tokens (dollars per million tokens).
settings.cachedTokenDesc: Cached input tokens (typically 50% of input rate)
settings.reasoningTokenDesc: Special reasoning/thinking tokens (fallback to output rate)
settings.cacheCreationTokenDesc: Tokens used to create cache entries (fallback to input rate)
settings.customPricingNote: You can override default pricing for specific models. Custom overrides take priority over auto-detected pricing.

translator.title: Translator
translator.metaDescription: Debug, test, and visualize API format translations between providers
translator.modeDescriptionPlayground: Paste any API request body and see how OmniRoute translates it between provider formats (OpenAI ↔ Claude ↔ Gemini ↔ Responses API)
translator.modeDescriptionChatTester: Send real chat requests through OmniRoute and inspect the full round-trip: input, translated request, provider response, and translated output.
translator.modeDescriptionTestBench: Run predefined scenarios and compare compatibility across providers and models.
translator.modeDescriptionLiveMonitor: Watch translation events in real time as requests flow through OmniRoute.
translator.modeDescriptionFallback: Debug, test, and visualize how OmniRoute translates API requests between providers.
translator.eventsAppearHint: Translation events appear here as requests flow through OmniRoute. Use any of these methods to generate events:
translator.inMemoryNote: Note: Events are stored in-memory and reset when the server restarts.
translator.formatConverterDescription: Paste or type a JSON request body. The translator will auto-detect the source format and convert it to the target format. Use this to debug how OmniRoute translates requests between formats (OpenAI ↔ Claude ↔ Gemini ↔ Responses API).
translator.inputPlaceholder: Paste a request body here or select a template below...
translator.templateLoadHint: Template loads the request in {format} format. Change Source Format to load in a different format.
translator.testBenchDescription: Run predefined scenarios (Simple Chat, Tool Calling, etc.) to verify translation and provider compatibility. Select a source format and target provider, then run all tests to see a compatibility percentage. Use this to find which features work across providers.
translator.pipelineVisualizationHint: Send a message to see how your request flows through detection → translation → provider call.
translator.chatTesterDescription: Send messages as a specific client format and inspect each step of the translation pipeline.
translator.chatTesterFlow: Client Request → Format Detection → OpenAI Intermediate → Provider Format → Response
translator.clickStepToInspect: Click any step to inspect the data at that stage.
translator.modelPlaceholder: Select or type a model name...
translator.sendMessageToSeePipeline: Send a message to see the translation pipeline
translator.chatMessageHintPrefix: Your message will be formatted as a
translator.chatMessageHintSuffix: request, translated through the pipeline, and sent to the selected provider.
translator.clientRequestDescription: The request body as your client would send it
translator.formatDetectedDescription: OmniRoute auto-detects the API format from the request structure
translator.openaiIntermediateDescription: All formats are first normalized to OpenAI format (the universal bridge)
translator.providerFormatDescription: OpenAI format is translated to the provider's native format
translator.providerResponseRawDescription: The raw response from the provider API
translator.providerResponseSseDescription: The raw SSE stream from the provider API
translator.liveMonitorDescriptionPrefix: Shows translation events as API calls flow through OmniRoute. Events come from the in-memory buffer (resets on restart). Use
translator.liveMonitorDescriptionSuffix: , or external API calls to generate events.

usage.title: Usage
usage.noApiKeysDescription: Add API keys first to set up budget limits.
usage.budgetExceeded: Budget exceeded — requests may be blocked
usage.howItWorksSubtitle: Learn how evaluations validate your LLM responses
usage.defineStepDescription: Create test cases with input prompts and expected output criteria using strategies like contains, regex, or exact match.
usage.runStepDescription: Execute test cases against your LLM endpoints through OmniRoute. Each case is sent as a real API request.
usage.evaluateStepDescription: Responses are compared against expected criteria. See pass/fail for each case with latency metrics and detailed feedback.
usage.evalSuitesHint: Click a suite to view test cases, then run to evaluate your LLM endpoints
usage.noEvalSuitesDescription: Eval suites can be defined via the API or in code. They test model outputs against expected results using strategies like contains, regex, exact match, and custom functions.
usage.runEvalHint: Click "Run Eval" to execute all cases against your LLM endpoint. Each test sends a real request through OmniRoute.
usage.notifyNoTestCases: No test cases defined for this suite
usage.evalsHeroDescription: Test and validate your LLM endpoints by running predefined evaluation suites. Each suite contains test cases that send real prompts through OmniRoute and compare responses against expected criteria — helping you detect regressions, compare models, and ensure response quality across providers.
usage.sessionsHint: Sessions appear as requests flow through the proxy
usage.connectProvidersForQuota: Connect to providers with OAuth to track your API quota limits and usage.
usage.noAccountsForTierFilter: No accounts found for tier filter

modals.pasteToken: Paste refresh token from Kiro IDE.

loggers.noPayloadData: No payload data available for this log entry.

auth.resetDescription: Choose a method to recover access to your dashboard
auth.pleaseWait: Please wait while we complete the authorization.
auth.methodCliDescription: Run the following command on the server where OmniRoute is running:
auth.methodCliHint: This will prompt you to set a new password. The server must be stopped first.
auth.methodManualDescription: Delete the password from the database and set a new one on startup:
auth.setPasswordInYour: Set a new password in your
auth.restartServerWithNewPassword: Restart the server - it will use the new password

docs.title: Documentation
docs.supportsChat: Supports both chat and responses endpoints.
docs.oauthAutoRefresh: OAuth connection with automatic token refresh.
docs.fullStreaming: Full streaming support for all models.
docs.docsHeroDescription: AI gateway for multi-provider LLMs. One endpoint for OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini, GitHub Copilot, Claude Code, Cursor, and 20+ more providers.
docs.quickStartStep1Middle: or clone from GitHub and run
docs.quickStartStep2Text: Go to Endpoint -> Registered Keys. Generate one key per environment.
docs.quickStartStep3Text: Add provider accounts via OAuth login, API key, or free-tier auto-connect.
docs.quickStartStep4Prefix: Point your IDE or API client to
docs.featureRoutingText: Route requests to 30+ AI providers through a single OpenAI-compatible endpoint. Supports chat, responses, audio, and image APIs.
docs.featureCombosText: Create model combos with fallback chains and balancing strategies: round-robin, priority, random, least-used, and cost-optimized.
docs.featureUsageText: Real-time token counting, cost calculation per provider/model, and detailed usage breakdown by API key and account.
docs.featureAnalyticsText: Visual analytics with charts for requests, tokens, errors, latency, costs, and model popularity over time.
docs.featureHealthText: Live health checks, provider status, circuit breaker states, and automatic rate limit detection with exponential backoff.
docs.featureCliText: Manage IDE configurations, export/import backups, discover codex profiles, and configure settings from the dashboard.
docs.featureSecurityText: API key authentication, IP filtering, prompt injection guard, domain policies, session management, and audit logging.
docs.featureCloudSyncText: Sync your configuration to Cloudflare Workers for remote access with encrypted credentials and automatic failover.
docs.useCaseSingleEndpointText: Point clients to one base URL and route by model prefix (for example: gh/, cc/, kr/, openai/).
docs.useCaseFallbackTitle: Fallback and model switching with combos
docs.useCaseFallbackText: Create combo models in Dashboard and keep client config stable while providers rotate internally.
docs.useCaseUsageVisibilityText: Track tokens and cost by provider, account, and API key in Usage and Analytics tabs.
docs.clientCursorBullet2: OAuth connection - login from the Providers page.
docs.endpointModelsNote: Model catalog for all connected providers.
docs.endpointRewriteModelsNote: Rewrite helper for model discovery without /v1.
docs.modelPrefixesDescriptionStart: Use the provider prefix before the model name to route to a specific provider. Example:
docs.troubleshootingModelRouting: If the client fails with model routing, use explicit provider/model (for example: gh/gpt-5.1-codex).
docs.troubleshootingAmbiguousModels: If you receive ambiguous model errors, pick a provider prefix instead of a bare model ID.
docs.troubleshootingCodexFamily: For GitHub Codex-family models, keep model as gh/<codex-model>; router selects /responses automatically.
docs.troubleshootingTestConnection: Use Dashboard > Providers > Test Connection before testing from IDEs or external clients.
docs.troubleshootingCircuitBreaker: If a provider shows circuit breaker open, wait for the cooldown or check Health page for details.
docs.troubleshootingOAuth: For OAuth providers, re-authenticate if tokens expire. Check the provider card status indicator.

legal.clearHistory: Clear usage history at any time
legal.backupRestore: Back up and restore your database
legal.privacyMetadataDescription: Privacy policy for the OmniRoute AI API proxy router.
legal.termsMetadataDescription: Terms of service for the OmniRoute AI API proxy router.
legal.privacySection1Text: OmniRoute is designed as a local-first application. All data processing and storage occurs entirely on your machine. There is no centralized server collecting your information.
legal.privacyDataStoredIn: The following data is stored locally in
legal.privacyDataProviderConfigurationsDesc: connection URLs, provider types, and priority settings
legal.privacyDataApiKeysDesc: encrypted and stored locally for authenticating with AI providers
legal.privacyDataUsageLogsDesc: request counts, token usage, model names, timestamps, and response times
legal.privacyDataApplicationSettingsDesc: theme preferences, routing strategy, and combo configurations
legal.privacySection3Text: OmniRoute does not collect telemetry, analytics, or crash reports. No data is sent to us or any third party. Your usage patterns, API calls, and configurations remain entirely private.
legal.privacySection4Text: When you make API calls through OmniRoute, your requests are forwarded to the AI providers you have configured (for example: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google). These providers have their own privacy policies that govern how they handle your data. Please review:
legal.privacySection5Text: If you enable the optional cloud sync feature, provider configurations and API keys may be transmitted to a configured cloud endpoint. This feature is disabled by default and requires explicit opt-in.
legal.privacyLoggingIntro: Request logs can be configured through the dashboard settings. You can:
legal.privacySection7TextStart: Since all data is stored locally, you have full control. You can delete your data at any time by removing the
legal.privacySection7TextEnd: directory or using the database backup and restore features in the dashboard.
legal.termsSection1Text: OmniRoute is a local-first AI API proxy router that operates entirely on your machine. It routes requests to multiple AI providers with load balancing, failover, and usage tracking.
legal.termsResponsibilityApiKeys: You are solely responsible for managing your own API keys and credentials for third-party AI providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, etc.).
legal.termsResponsibilityCompliance: You must comply with the terms of service of each AI provider whose API you access through OmniRoute.
legal.termsResponsibilitySecurity: You are responsible for the security of your local OmniRoute installation, including setting a password and restricting network access.
legal.termsSection3Text: OmniRoute acts as an intermediary proxy. API calls sent to OmniRoute are translated and forwarded to your configured AI providers. OmniRoute does not modify the content of your requests or responses beyond the necessary protocol translation.
legal.termsDataStoredLocally: All data is stored locally on your machine in a SQLite database.
legal.termsNoTransmission: OmniRoute does not transmit any data to external servers unless you explicitly enable cloud sync features.
legal.termsDataLocationText: Usage logs, API keys, and configuration are stored in
legal.termsSection5Text: OmniRoute is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. We are not responsible for any costs incurred through API usage, service disruptions, or data loss. Always maintain backups of your configuration.
legal.termsSection6Text: OmniRoute is open-source software. You are free to inspect, modify, and distribute it under the terms of its license.
